Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How to build the open xml?" (#522) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi
For one of my projects I want to embedd the open xml into one of my dlls . I started downloading master Open xml from below address: https://github.com/OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK And tried to build it first, but to my dismay its saying The SDK 'Microsoft.NET.Sdk' specified could not be found

I have looked at below address and I saw I have installed these .net cores: C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk

1.0.0, 1.1.9, 1.1.10, 2.0.2, 2.1.2, 2.1.201, 2.1.202, 2.1.400, 2.1.401

In the cs project its written netstandard1.3 is needed. But I can not find this package on microsoft website.

Do you know how I can build OpenXml?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Bullets are broken when converting to html on the webview" (#258) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
**Error description** ```

 Constipation

 Itching

``` The square in `.pt-000006` is a bullet sybmol. It displays on the PC, but on the IOS you it looks in next way: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11064696/47010806-c05d7180-d148-11e8-80b1-7547ee0a4ea3.png) Also the same problem for a lot of other characters, f.e. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11064696/47011013-6a3cfe00-d149-11e8-800f-247289625fd2.png) these quotes will not display both on android and ios **What expected** Replace where possible characters with html codes, f.e. bullet code: `•`

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "RevisionAccepter.AcceptRevisions may strip non-content nodes from document (bookmarks & others)" (#257) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
It seems `RevisionAccepter.AcceptRevisions` will 'eat' certain markup fragments. I'd bet this is the same root cause as #227.

Our document fragment was 
```xml
...
        <w:p w:rsidR="00DB00F9" w:rsidRPr="00DB00F9" w:rsidRDefault="00DB00F9" w:rsidP="00DB00F9">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:rFonts w:ascii="Arial" w:hAnsi="Arial" w:cs="Arial"/>
                    <w:sz w:val="20"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
        </w:p>
        <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="0"/>
        <w:bookmarkEnd w:id="7"/>
        <w:p w:rsidR="00DB00F9" w:rsidRPr="00DB00F9" w:rsidRDefault="00DB00F9" w:rsidP="00DB00F9">
            <w:pPr>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:rFonts w:ascii="Arial" w:hAnsi="Arial" w:cs="Arial"/>
                    <w:sz w:val="20"/>
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
        </w:p>
...
```
**(Note the two bookmark pointers in between the paragraphs)**
This will get 'accepted' as:
```xml
...
        <w:p>
            <w:pPr>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:rFonts w:ascii="Arial" w:hAnsi="Arial" w:cs="Arial" />
                    <w:sz w:val="20" />
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
        </w:p>
        <w:p>
            <w:pPr>
                <w:rPr>
                    <w:rFonts w:ascii="Arial" w:hAnsi="Arial" w:cs="Arial" />
                    <w:sz w:val="20" />
                </w:rPr>
            </w:pPr>
        </w:p>
...
```
**Note the bookmark references are now missing**

Some extended breakpoint stepping points to `RevisionProcessor.AcceptDeletedAndMoveFromParagraphMarksTransform` as the culprit, specifically the loop/logic at https://github.com/OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools/blob/f7d36ead3345c255f2b48030944009a9f35850ce/OpenXmlPowerTools/RevisionProcessor.cs#L2109 and the grouping logic inside `IterateBlockContentElements`.
Seems this code completely ignores (and **skips!**) any interleaved non `p` or `tbl` tags between elements.

My gut feeling says this requires "chunking" into contiguous block content sequences (broken at "other" element occurrences) before zipping elements up (and I admittedly do _not_ follow the whole paragraph/table combination logic).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Fix issue related to text-align with rtl direction" (#256) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody: When adding style="direction:rtl; text-align:left" it doesn't apply text-align property.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Refactor WmlComparer" (#255) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
This commit refactors the `WmlComparer`, putting classes into their own files and splitting the very large `WmlComparer` class into multiple partial classes. If further fixes many (but not all) issues flagged by
static code analysis.

For easier reference, the existing `WmlComparer` class is temporarily retained in the `OpenXmlPowerTools.Previous` namespace. For organizational purposes, the refactored version is stored in the`Comparer` folder, which does however not create a namespace.

The objective of this commit is to not create breaking changes. The one exception is the removal of the internal `WmlComparer.Coalesce` method, which was only invoked in one unit test. This is deemed a left-over from previous rewrites and is thus removed. The unit test is commented
out for now.

This pull request essentially prepares the `WmlComparer` for future enhancements.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Converting ordered/unordered lists" (#254) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
When converting an ordered list to word using ConvertHtmlToWml output is always an unordered list. Input:
  1. ordered list
  2. zwei
  • unordered list
  • bullet
Output: • ordered list • zwei • unordered list • bullet

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "HtmlToWmlCssParser.cs Parsing Error" (#253) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,

There is a CSS parsing error that occurs in HtmlToWmlCssParser.cs.

The CSS parser throws an exception for the following CSS style:
`border: solid red .5pt`

On the other side the following CSS style string is properly parsed:
`border: solid red 0.5pt`

I would try to  fix this myself, but I haven't seen any grammar file in the project where I could fix this. It seems like the CSS parsing classes are auto generated. Can someone tell me where can I get it and which  parser generator technology is used?
